name: React + TypeScript Best Practices
description: Modern React development with TypeScript strict mode
rules: Always use TypeScript strict mode and explicit return types for all functions
Prefer functional components with React hooks over class components
Use named exports instead of default exports for better refactoring
Props interfaces should use PascalCase and end with 'Props' suffix
Custom hooks must start with 'use' prefix (e.g., useAuth, useData)
Avoid prop drilling - use Context API or state management for deep nesting
Use React.memo() for expensive component renders, but measure first
Extract complex logic into custom hooks for reusability
Use TypeScript generics for reusable components
Prefer composition over inheritance for component design
